com.revolsys.gis.algorithm

Class MatchDistance

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revolsys.gis.algorithm.MatchDistance

  • public final class MatchDistance
extends Object
    Computes various distance functions for determining how far apart are two matched segments. In general these functions use the Hausdorff distance to compute how far apart geometries are, since the normal Euclidean distance is not a useful measure of "far apartness".

    • Method Summary

      Computes the maximum distance apart between two linestrings.

      Computes the fraction of length of matched LineStrings which is nearer than a given tolerance value (optionally after trimming).
      static double trimmedDistance(LineString a, LineString b)
      Computes how far apart are two linestrings after trimming any unmatched length at the ends.

    • Method Detail

      • maxDistance

        public static double maxDistance(LineString a,
                 LineString b)
        Computes the maximum distance apart between two linestrings. (Note this is NOT the distance between the two furthest points on the linestrings, which is not a useful measure of "farness").
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:

      • nearnessFraction

        public static double nearnessFraction(LineString a,
                      LineString b,
                      double tolerance)
        Computes the fraction of length of LineStrings which is within a given tolerance value, after trimming. The previously computed maxDistance between the lines can be supplied to allow optimizing the calculation (if maxDistance < tolerance, the nearness fraction = 1.0).
        Parameters:
        a - a LineString
        b - a LineString
        fullDistance - the full distance between the lines (previously computed)
        tolerance - the distance beyond which to total the length
        Returns:
        the fraction of length beyond the tolerance

      • nearnessFraction

        public static double nearnessFraction(LineString a,
                      LineString b,
                      double tolerance,
                      boolean trimLines)
        Computes the fraction of length of LineStrings which is within a given tolerance value, after trimming.
        Parameters:
        a - a LineString
        b - a LineString
        tolerance - the distance beyond which to total the length
        trimLines - true if the computation should take the trimmed lines into account
        Returns:
        the fraction of matched line length beyond the tolerance

      • nearnessFraction

        public static double nearnessFraction(LineString a,
                      LineString b,
                      double maxDistance,
                      double tolerance,
                      boolean trimLines)
        Computes the fraction of length of matched LineStrings which is nearer than a given tolerance value (optionally after trimming). The previously computed maxDistance between the lines can be supplied to allow optimizing the calculation (if maxDistance < tolerance, the nearness fraction = 1.0).
        Parameters:
        a - a LineString
        b - a LineString
        maxDistance - the maximum distance between the lines (if previously computed)
        tolerance - the distance beyond which to total the length
        trimLines - true if the computation should take the trimmed lines into account
        Returns:
        the fraction of matched line length beyond the tolerance

      • trimmedDistance

        public static double trimmedDistance(LineString a,
                     LineString b)
        Computes how far apart are two linestrings after trimming any unmatched length at the ends.
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        MaximalNearestSubline
